verses.verse: (Ps. 102:26; Is. 13:13; Ezek. 32:7, 8; Joel 2:31; Matt. 24:29; 2 Pet. 3:10) All the host of heaven shall be dissolved, And the heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll; (Is. 14:12) All their host shall fall down As the leaf falls from the vine, And as (Rev. 6:12-14) fruit falling from a fig tree.

“For (Deut. 32:41, 42; Jer. 46:10; Ezek. 21:3-5) My sword shall be bathed in heaven; Indeed it (Is. 63:1; Jer. 49:7, 8, 20; Ezek. 25:12-14; 35:1-15; Amos 1:11, 12; Obad. 1-14; Mal. 1:4) shall come down on Edom, And on the people of My curse, for judgment.

The (Is. 66:16) sword of the LORD is filled with blood, It is made overflowing with fatness, With the blood of lambs and goats, With the fat of the kidneys of rams. For (Zeph. 1:7) the LORD has a sacrifice in Bozrah, And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
The wild oxen shall come down with them, And the young bulls with the mighty bulls; Their land shall be soaked with blood, And their dust saturated with fatness.”
For it is the day of the LORD’s (Is. 63:4) vengeance, The year of recompense for the cause of Zion.
(Deut. 29:23; Ps. 11:6; Is. 30:33) Its streams shall be turned into pitch, And its dust into brimstone; Its land shall become burning pitch.

It shall not be quenched night or day; (Rev. 14:11; 18:18; 19:3) Its smoke shall ascend forever. (Is. 13:20-22; 24:1; 34:10-15; Mal. 1:3, 4) From generation to generation it shall lie waste; No one shall pass through it forever and ever.

(Is. 14:23; Zeph. 2:14; Rev. 18:2) But the pelican and the porcupine shall possess it, Also the owl and the raven shall dwell in it. And (2 Kin. 21:13; Lam. 2:8) He shall stretch out over it The line of confusion and the stones of emptiness.
They shall call its nobles to the kingdom, But none shall be there, and all its princes shall be nothing.
And (Is. 32:13; Hos. 9:6) thorns shall come up in its palaces, Nettles and brambles in its fortresses; (Is. 13:21) It shall be a habitation of jackals, A courtyard for ostriches.
